content: I am trying to build opencpn and ran into a problem. The include file, chcnav.h, is missing. Can someone tell me what GitHub repository to add or if the file is auto-generated by a build. I am using vs code for the build.

Hi Steve. On what operating system are you compiling? Linux? Windows? Macos? There are specific instructions for each to explain how to prepare your machine before building. Have you followed those instructions for your operating system?
Where are the build instructions? I am working on Windows 11.
Hello, not sure where to post this problem but I just compiled OCPN from github (v5.13.0) and the default dashboard plugin is not available anymore (not even in the plugin list). Any idea why ?
My crystal ball says you did not install it. If you read your logfile, you will see what is happening when opencpn looks for the plugins during start.

The dashboard plugin was already installed in 5.12.2. After compiling and launching 5.13 it disappeared but others installed plugins stayed (SAR, shipdriver, ais_radar, etc)

At startup it says :

The following library has encountered errors during startup:
/usr/local/lib/opencpn/libdashboard_pi.so
The library will be removed. You might want to reinstall it's associated plugin after updating the catalog

Of course I already tried to update the catalog but still missing.

Here's what the log file says :

15:18:24.610 MESSAGE plugin_loader.cpp:1495 PluginLoader: Loading PlugIn: /usr/local/lib/opencpn/libdashboard_pi.so
15:18:24.612 ERROR dlunix.cpp:120 Failed to load shared library '/usr/local/lib/opencpn/libdashboard_pi.so': /usr/local/lib/opencpn/libdashboard_pi.so: undefined symbol: _ZN8NMEA0183lsER8wxString
15:18:24.612 MESSAGE plugin_loader.cpp:1540 Ignoring blacklisted plugin libdashboard_pi
15:18:24.612 MESSAGE plugin_loader.cpp:1550 PluginLoader: Cannot load library: /usr/local/lib/opencpn/libdashboard_pi.so
